posts.post_content:
I understand this card is balanced for standard but for casual games with friends and stuff this card is completely broken. It should cost like ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) maybe more...
  
And why do all the T2 decks need to have so many removals just to get rid of this? I mean I haven't seen any T2 deck with less that 2 kind of removals X4 each... All in case someone cast all these crazy creatures that are T2 such as [Terra Stomper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terra Stomper) this, and the 9/9 shroud (Whitch posses the less threat of all.)
  
   
And another thing that I don't understand is that they excuse this by making it Mythic Rare? Ok wizards let me know then if you make another rarety such as Epic Rare and put something like:
  
   
Ultra Super Power Savant Monster ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)   
Haste, Trample, Double Strike
  
6/5
  
   
And I promise you that you will get some fanatic player who would pay with their lives to get it but the games would have been already ruined. So what do you prefer? To make money or to make a game that will last for generation... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: PhyrexianLobbiest (10/26/2009 12:53:36 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card epitomizes everything I hate about modern Magic. Totally over powered / under coasted. Nothing fun about this card at all, Simply put this card reads "unless you have X4 of this card as well you will probably not beat me" cards like this ruin the game, they take away the strategy / skill and creativity and create a situation where there is just one best deck, which every one has. I love Magic the Gathering but the more I see this kind of insane card in newer sets the less inclined I am to buy newer sets and less likely I am to play new opponents as my not playing this doesn’t stop others from doing so.  
Shame on you Wizards for deciding that Mythic Rare should = overpowered and un-fun.
posts.html:
This card epitomizes everything I hate about modern Magic. Totally over powered / under coasted. Nothing fun about this card at all, Simply put this card reads "unless you have X4 of this card as well you will probably not beat me" cards like this ruin the game, they take away the strategy / skill and creativity and create a situation where there is just one best deck, which every one has. I love Magic the Gathering but the more I see this kind of insane card in newer sets the less inclined I am to buy newer sets and less likely I am to play new opponents as my not playing this doesn’t stop others from doing so.
Shame on you Wizards for deciding that Mythic Rare should = overpowered and un-fun.

posts.post_content:
so overpowered it makes sane people cringe, yes any white players love it, but this is just power creep going too far, this is near invincible and will haunt magic for years, there will be one nailed to the wall in every designer's room with a sign, NEVER AGAIN, just as a warning to them to never let something like this happen again, it was completely uncalled for  
  
Bogarden Hellkite is the closest thing in terms of power in the same set to this card and even then, that is fairer, a 5/5 flying flasher that blasts multiple things when it comes in priced reasonably for its abilities

as NecroArTeest said
  
 "*baneslayer's lifelink, first strike and +1/+1 (not to mention pro demons/dragons) > serra's vigilance.
  
   
both die to removal. (removal excuse is invalid)
  
   
what is serra's advantage giving that it has the same cost as baneslayer?
  
   
it has none.
  
   
realistically serra = virtually useless.
  
   
baneslayer will replace it nine times out of ten.
  
   
aka power creep.* "
  
I'm pretty sure liflink itself = vigilince because unless you're going to chump block you should have the same board position from it (attack = 4 (5 but this is ignoring the +1/+1 in order to look at the ability matchup) damage to opponent, +4 life, taken later as damage when opponent attacks, no creature loss... vs. attack for 4 damage, then block opponent and trade, both lose a creature and your net life is still the same) then you get bonus +1/+1, first strike, and pro demons/dragons just cuz
  
   
I think I'd hate this card less if Serra Angel wasn't in the set... but why wotc, why destroy a c... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: MizoreIceQueen (1/17/2010 12:18:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
At 3WW she is insanely cheap, but hardly a "GIN" card when she arrives. I always stack my decks with plenty of creature control and my crosshairs would drop on her as soon as she hit the table. Cards like this are mythically rare for a reason. It would take someone a fortune to get four of her in their deck and if they have the Money to do that, then their deck is probably ridiculous in the first place.
  
   
I LIKE the fact that Hasbro creates cards like this and makes them hard to find. It adds a mystery and luck to the game. Powerful cards should be extremely rare. The game is more strategy than "who can put the most powerful creatures in their decks." I've built very successful decks out of commons and uncommons with nothing with a mana cost above 3 and kicked some serious \*\*\* with them.
  
   
Any card can be dealt with: doom blade, deathmark, terror, pacify, divine verdict, seismic strike, fireball, blinding mage, assassinate etc. need I say more?
posts.html:

I LIKE the fact that Hasbro creates cards like this and makes them hard to find. It adds a mystery and luck to the game. Powerful cards should be extremely rare. The game is more strategy than "who can put the most powerful creatures in their decks." Any card can be dealt with: doom blade, deathmark, terror, pacify, divine verdict, seismic strike, fireball, blinding mage, assassinate etc. need I say more?

posts.post_content:
No offense, but anyone not giving this thing a 5/5 does not realize how absurdly broken this card is.  
  
"Oooooh it dies to removal, this card suxors."  
  
Yeah, and so does 95% of the creatures out there. Unlike most of those creatures though, an unanswered Baneslayer basically says: You win.  
  
And no, I'm not one of the guys who goes out and buys a playset of the "staple" cards to keep fresh decks..the most I've spent on a single card is like $2, and then I trade for card I think would be effective. Yet cards like this make me cringe at how over-powered they are.
